div.p: APPROPRIATE so as to FIT the FACTS or the PRINCIPLES PERFECTLY.
APPROPRIATE so as to FIT the FACTS or the PRINCIPLES.
1. The standard word for conformity with an established standard of behavioural or physical allignment zhèng 正 (ant. xié 邪 ).
2. Jiǎo 矯 refers to bringing something in to proper physical shape.
3. Kuāng 匡 refers to typically political proper allignment and correct coordination.
4. Qí 齊 refers to something being or being made well-aligned, evened out, and straight, often in metaphysical senses.
CAUSATIVE USES MUST BE MOVED TO "MAKE CORRECT!". THIS IS STILL A MESS. CH
rough draft to BEGIN TO identify synonym group members for analysis, based on CL etc. 18.11.2003. CH ／

note.p: corrigere refers to an authoritative act of emendation or correction which sets things right.
emendare is the friendly act of emendation or correction characterised by sympathy and a common aim.

中國文化背景八千詞 Zhongguo wenhua beijing ba qian ci

sense.def: up to scatch, of proper quality; decent 不倫

entry.def: Kuāng 匡 refers to typically political proper allignment and correct coordination.

sense.def: correctly, in a straight and formally correct manner; bring order to
get into proper shape; cause to be proper; to correct
desposit in the ritually correct place
take up a stable and ritually correct position

bibl.title: 唐五代語言詞典 Táng Wǔdài yǔyán cídiǎn A Dictionary of the Language of the Tang and Five Dynasties Periods

entry.def: The standard word for conformity with an established standard of behavioural or physical allignment zhèng 正(ant. xié 邪).

sense.def: right way fo doing things correctness in behaviour, correct behaviour
OBI: proper process, proper outcome; exact behaviour (of cosmic forces etc);
that which is correct; those who are correct, those who behave correctly
ojectively correct or appropriate; prescribed and correct or efficient
CHEMLA 2003: the exact (quantity); the exact/correct procedureJZ 7.4, Liu Hui's comm: 不盈不朒之正數 "the exact quantity, without excess and without shortfall"
correctly, with formal correctness; exactly, precisely
be morally upright and correct; be legally correct and exact
behave correctly; not deviate from the norm
(cause to be correct>) adjust so as to make correct or adequate for the purpose; to correct; ensure the correctness of
consider as right and proper; consider as ritually correct
go on correctly as it is supposed to
N=human: set on the right path, correct the ways of
be put in order, be properly ordered
regular; according to the correct pattern
be fitting and right, be as it should be

entry.def: Jiǎo 矯 refers to bringing something in to proper physical shape.

sense.def: straighten out, correct, set right; force into right shape
be morally upright and correct; be in the right
derived meaning: mend (one's ways); correct (one's faults); make up for
be correct; be right; be proper

entry.def: Qí 齊 refers to something being or being made well-aligned, evened out, and straight, often in metaphysical senses.

sense.def: those who are morally correct in their behaviour
to be supremely well-adjusted; to be supernaturally well-attuned
precisely "calculated">considered and measures so as to be correct
those who are of correct attitude
cause to become appropriate and correct> to correct, to straighten out
seem to be all right, seem to be the right thing to do
of one's thinking: be precise and reliable
= jiao3chi4 矯飭: make correct, reform
be according to the rules, be correct
be correct in relation to Nab
be impeccable; be faultless; be without blame.
